author: Dr. Smith
text:
CHIEF COMPLAINT: Chest pain for 2 days.
HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: 45-year-old male presents with substernal chest pain radiating to left arm. Pain is 7/10, worse with exertion. Denies shortness of breath, denies nausea.
PAST MEDICAL HISTORY: Hypertension, Type 2 diabetes. No history of myocardial infarction.
MEDICATIONS: Lisinopril 10mg daily, Metformin 500mg BID.
ALLERGIES: Penicillin (rash).
SOCIAL HISTORY: Smokes 1 pack per day for 20 years. Works as a construction manager.
PHYSICAL EXAM: BP 150/95, HR 88, RR 16. Lungs clear to auscultation.
ASSESSMENT AND PLAN: Rule out acute coronary syndrome. Schedule stress test. Follow up in 1 week.

author: Dr. Johnson
text:
CHIEF COMPLAINT: Follow-up for diabetes management.
HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: Patient reports good adherence to medications. Blood glucose readings average 140 mg/dL. Denies polyuria, denies polydipsia.
PAST MEDICAL HISTORY: Type 2 diabetes x 5 years, Hyperlipidemia.
MEDICATIONS: Metformin 1000mg BID, Atorvastatin 20mg daily.
ALLERGIES: No known drug allergies.
LABORATORY DATA: HbA1c 7.2%, LDL 110 mg/dL.
ASSESSMENT AND PLAN: Diabetes well controlled. Continue current regimen. Return in 3 months.

author: Dr. Williams
text:
CHIEF COMPLAINT: Annual physical examination.
HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: 52-year-old female with no acute complaints. Denies fever, denies cough, denies weight loss.
PAST MEDICAL HISTORY: Hypothyroidism, Osteoarthritis.
MEDICATIONS: Levothyroxine 75mcg daily, Ibuprofen PRN.
SOCIAL HISTORY: Non-smoker, occasional alcohol. Works as a teacher.
FAMILY HISTORY: Mother with breast cancer, father with CAD.
REVIEW OF SYSTEMS: Constitutional: negative. Cardiovascular: negative.
PHYSICAL EXAM: Vital signs normal. HEENT unremarkable.
ASSESSMENT AND PLAN: Healthy. Recommend mammogram screening. Follow up in 1 year.

author: Dr. Brown
text:
CHIEF COMPLAINT: Lower back pain.
HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: 38-year-old male with acute lower back pain after lifting heavy box. Pain radiates to right leg. Denies bowel/bladder incontinence.
PAST MEDICAL HISTORY: None significant.
MEDICATIONS: Naproxen 500mg BID PRN.
IMAGING: X-ray lumbar spine shows mild degenerative changes.
ASSESSMENT AND PLAN: Musculoskeletal strain. Prescribe physical therapy. Avoid heavy lifting.

author: Dr. Davis
text:
CHIEF COMPLAINT: Medication refill.
HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: Patient requests refill of asthma inhaler. Reports using albuterol 2 times last week. Denies nighttime symptoms.
PAST MEDICAL HISTORY: Asthma, Allergic rhinitis.
MEDICATIONS: Albuterol inhaler PRN, Fluticasone nasal spray.
ALLERGIES: Dust mites.
ASSESSMENT AND PLAN: Asthma well controlled. Refill medications. Return PRN.
